item.title: Students Save With Textbook Rental At The Collegiate Store!
item.description:
Wednesday, August 30, 2017 12:00 AM - Fri , December 22, 2017 12:00 AM
Where: Rensselaer Collegiate Store 1st Floor, Rensselaer Student Union
Description: Last year, we saved RPI students over $165,000 with our rental program! -Renting saves at least 50% or more of the purchase price of a new textbook. -Use your book! Highlight and take notes. -Rent your books in store or online at www.rensselaerstore.com. What's Next? Rent now! Convert later! If you want to keep your book, convert it to purchase at any time during the semester up to and including the due date. Simply pay the difference between the rental price and purchase price.
Contact: Rensselaer Union Bookstore 518-276-6555

item.title: RPI RELIEF: Harvey, Irma and Maria Response
item.description:
Monday, September 11, 2017 - Sun , December 31, 2017 (all day)
Where: Academy Hall 4629
Cost: varies per event
Description: RPI Relief: Harvey, Irma and Maria has mobilized in fall 2017 to conduct activities within the Rensselaer Community to raise money in support of relief organizations working on the ground in Texas, Florida, Puerto Rico and the U.S.Virgin Islands. Some RPI organizations are raising money for specific causes, while unrestricted funds raised throughout this campaign will be distributed to the American Red Cross and to All Hands Volunteers. Check the website for updates on new events and totals.
Contact: Community Service - DOSO 518-276-3098

item.title: Rensselaer Club Launches Annual Membership Campaign
item.description:
Monday, October 2, 2017 - Mon , December 4, 2017 (all day)
Where: Off-campus (see description) online
Cost: 25.00
Description: The Rensselaer Club is conducting its annual membership campaign. Dues for the year are $25 per person and can be paid online. The club is a not-for-profit organization and a part of your dues are considered a donation. We sponsor some "members only" events during the year. Your dues also help support local charities.
Contact: Jamie Auger 518-276-2895

item.title: Fall 2017 SoE Midterm Student Course Evaluations Now Open
item.description:
Friday, October 6, 2017 - Sun , October 15, 2017 (all day)
Where: RPI Troy Campus
Description: Fall 2017 SoE Midterm course evaluations are now open. Your feedback is very important to the Institute and the SoE, so please complete evaluation surveys for all your courses! Evaluations will be available through Sunday, October 15, 2017.
Contact: Office of Undergraduate Education 518.276.2244

item.title: Campaign Hours for Folsom Library
item.description:
Monday, October 9, 2017 - Sun , October 15, 2017 (all day)
Where: Folsom Library
Description: For the week of the Campaign Launch, the Folsom Library will operate on the following schedule: Thursday – 10/12/17 – First and second floors of Folsom Library will be unavailable, third and fourth floors will be open for use Friday – 10/13/17 – Folsom Library will be closed all day Saturday – 10/14/17 – Folsom library will open at noon
Contact: Folsom Library 518-276-8329 Kathy Stebbins

item.title: Campaign Launch and Reunion & Homecoming 2017
item.description:
Thursday, October 12, 2017 - Sun , October 15, 2017 (all day)
Where: Troy Campus Troy, NY
Description: Join us as we celebrate the launch of a capital campaign designed to position Rensselaer for its third century of leadership in research and education with a variety of immersive events. Returning alumni/ae will include classes ending in 2 or 7, Greeks, former athletes, and student groups. See the website for details.
Contact: Alumni Relations 518-276-6205

item.title: Campaign Launch and Reunion & Homecoming 2017
item.description:
Thursday, October 12, 2017 12:00 AM - Sun , October 15, 2017 12:00 AM
Where: Campus-wide
Description: Join us from Oct.12-15 as we celebrate the launch of a capital campaign designed to position Rensselaer for its third century of leadership in research and education with a variety of immersive events. See the website for details: alumni.rpi.edu/reunion
Contact: Alumni Relations 518-276-6205

item.title: Additional Study Hall Space
item.description:
Thursday, October 12, 2017 (all day)
Where: DCC 308 and 318
Description: Preparation for this weekend's events will be impacting student use of the Library. To insure that there is additional study space for students rooms have been reserved in DCC 308 and DCC 318 as follows: DCC 308 - 6:00pm - 9:00pm DCC 318 - 8:00am - 9:00am, 1:00pm - 2:00pm and 6:00pm - 9:00pm Two other areas to consider for use are the Off Campus Commons and the JEC Student Lounge.
Contact: Sherry Perpetua 276-6566

item.title: The on-call shuttle will be unavailable on Thursday, October 12th and Friday, October 13th
item.description:
Thursday, October 12, 2017 8:00 AM - Fri , October 13, 2017 4:00 PM
Where: Parking and Transportation Office 2144 Burdett Ave
Description: The on-call shuttle will be unavailable on Thursday, October 12th and Friday, October 13th. The on-call shuttle will resume service on Monday, 16th from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m.
Contact: Parking and Transportation 518-276-6616

item.title: Artisans and Crafters Needed for 2017 United Way Community Fair
item.description:
Friday, October 13, 2017 9:00 AM
Where: ECAV East Campus Athletic Village
Description: Community Fair and Bake Sale – Attention Artisans, Crafters, Bakers, and Entrepreneurs! In conjunction with Procurement’s Supplier Showcase, the United Way is proudly hosting the Community Fair and Bake Sale again this year on Friday, November 3, from 11:00 am – 2 pm! If you have a creative talent and/or a product that you think students, staff, and faculty would be interested in purchasing for themselves or for others, contact Denise Elwell at elweld@rpi.edu for details on participating.
Contact: Denise Elwell 276-4873
